isValidAccountSignature(bytes32,bytes).details: This function assumes the caller is the account that wants to validate a signature. This function is NOT intended to be called directly by third party contracts other than accounts.

params.hash: The hash to validate the signature against.

returns._0: isSignatureValid Boolean indicating whether the signature is valid.

params.opTarget: The target of the user operation, see `OpTarget`.
params.userOp: The user operation to be validated.
params.userOpHash: The hash of the user operation computed by EntryPoint.

OWNER_KEY().notice: The key used to retrieve ownership data from the validator's storage space.

getEthSignedMessageHash(bytes32).notice: Helper function to get the signed hash for signature validation. This function (1) appends the address of the validator to the message hash, (2) hash them together and (3) prefix the result with EthSignedMessage.

getOwner(address).notice: This method does not guarantee this validator is currently activated by the `account`.

isValidAccountSignature(bytes32,bytes).notice: Validate a signature against a hash, based on the ownership data of the caller (`msg.sender`). This is to support ERC-1271.

documentation.text: @notice If `prevOwner` equals to zero address, this event indicates initalization.
@notice This method does not guarantee this validator is currently activated by the `account`.

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (enum SignatureType,bytes32,bytes memory,bytes memory) view returns (bool)
